One of the biggest things that students really need to take into consideration is, once they get out of school, they really want to take a look at the consolidation of their student loans to be able to get those rates fixed and get them brought down.

When you get back into the repayment, sometimes they can be a little tougher to deal with as well.
Now the other thing that you also want to take into consideration as a student is you don't want to consolidate your private loans along with your federal loans, Stafford loans, if you will.
When you do that, the higher rate is going to apply; and if you consolidate the two of them, you may have lost a lot of benefit from those federal rates that you did have.
So, in a way, it makes more sense to kind of pay off the private loans first.

There are all sorts of tools and mechanisms that are available to students in order to be able to either postpone the immediate payment or to establish a payment plan so that they can actually handle it.
